intro: Onosma bheriensis, commonly known as the Kashmir wallflower, is a flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool and moist conditions. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and branching. Onosma bheriensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
